MainHeading.P: Chuaigh an Ceann Comhairle i gceannas ar 2.30 p.m.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Deisiú Bóthar.
MainHeading.P: 1. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Coughlan Mr. Coughlan
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta i ngeall ar an damáiste a tharla do bhóithre, iad sin nach bhfuil ar an gcontae, i nGaeltacht Thír Chonaill i rith an tsamhraidh i mbliana, an gcuirfidh sé airgead ar fáil le iad a dheisiú.

MainHeading.P: 7. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta cad iad na bóithre áise i gContae Dhún na nGall ar measadh deontas dóibh i nDeireadh Fómhair/ Samhain, 1985.

Speaker.hpid: Aire Airgeadais (Mr. Dukes) (ar son Aire na Gaeltachta) Aire Airgeadais (Mr. Dukes) (ar son Aire na Gaeltachta)
Speaker.NameTxt: Aire Airgeadais (Mr. Dukes) (ar son Aire na Gaeltachta)
Speaker.P: Tógfaidh mé Ceist a 1 agus Ceist a 7 le chéile.
Seo a leanas na bóithre a ceadaíodh i nDeireadh Fómhair/Samhain 1985:

row.entry: Feabhsú an bhóthair áise chuig teach na nUasal Séamus Mac Suibhne agus Dónall Ó Gallchóir, Machaire Chlochair, Doirí Beaga

Feabhsú an bhóthair áise go teach an Uasail Bríd Ní Rabhartaigh, Carraig an tSeascain, Doirí Beaga
Feabhsú an bhóthair áise go teach an Uasail Dónall Ó Frighil, Sraith Máirtín, Doirí Beaga

Feabhsú an bhóthair áise go teach an Uasail Éamonn Mac Éidigh, Glas Dobharchú, Mín Lárnach

MainHeading.P: Tá an méid airgid is féidir le mo Roinnse a sholáthar i mbliana le haghaidh bóithre íoctha nó geallta cheana féin agus tá suim £16,600 geallta do bhóithre i nDún na nGall.

Soláthar £25,000 a bhí ar fáil i mbliana le haghaidh bóithre i meastacháin na Roinne. Níor éirigh leis na comhairlí contae áfach na hoibreacha a ceadaíodh Nollaig 1984 (.i. deontais £39,700) a dhéanamh sa bhliain sin agus tugadh cead dóibh na hoibreacha a dhéanamh i mbliana.
Chomh maith leis sin ceadaíodh deontais bhreise £23,370 i rith na bliana seo rud a fhágfaidh go mbeidh £63,070 le seasamh i mbliana.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Os rud é nach raibh na comhairlí chontae, go háirithe i nDún na nGall, in ann an t-airgead sin a chaitheamh mar nach raibh sé ar fáil go dtí taréis Nollag, an nglacann an tAire gur rud ró-ghlic a bhí ann gan an t-airgead curtha ar fáil ag an Rialtas ach go mall i mí na Nollag, agus coinníoll ann go gcaithfear an t-airgead roimh dheireadh na bliana? An gcuirfidh an tAire Airgeadais brú ar an Roinn gan rudaí mar sin a dhéanamh feasta ar mhuintir na Gaeltachta?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Ní ghlacaim gur cleas a bhí ann, go mór mhór os rud é gur thugamar ar aghaidh an £39,700 nár caitheadh i 1984 go dtí 1985.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Nach bhfuil dualgas ar an Aire níos mó airgid a chur ar fáil i mbliana, agus go gcaithfear é a chur ar fáil i rith na bliana nuair atá an aimsear feiliúnach chun na bóithre a dheisiú? Rud tábhachtach, an nglacann an tAire maidir le deisiú bóthar i rith Dheireadh Fómhair agus na Samhna go bhfuil an chuid is mó de na bóitre sin ag dul go dtí tithe ina bhfuil lucht leanúna Fhine Gael ina gcónaí iontu? An nglacfaidh sé nach raibh bóthar ar bith deisithe sna Rosanna, i gCloch an Fhaolaidh agus i nGaeltacht Lár nó Deisceart Dhún na nGall. Tá mé ag cur i leith an Aíre agus Roinn na Gaeltachta go bhfuil siad ag caitheamh airgid ar bhóithre ina bhfuil teach amháin agus nach bhfuil siad ag caitheamh airgid ar bhóithre cosúil le a bóthar chuig eastát tionscail na Doirí Beaga. Tá 800 daoine ag obair ansin agus níor caitheadh fiú amháin pingin rua ar an mbóthar sin. Tá a fhios agam nach é an Aire anois sa Teach a rinne é sin agus táim cinnte nach n-aontaíonn sé leis.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Is ráiteas a bhí ar siúl ag an Teachta in ionad ceist agus is olc an mhaise don Teachta a leithéid sin de ráiteas a dhéanamh sa Teach.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Nac bhfuil an chosúlacht ann ón fhreagra a thug an tAire gur cuireadh na deontais ar fáil do dhaoine nach raibh ach muirín amháin ar an mbóthar? An nglacann sé nach bhfuil sé sin ag teacht leis an Acht féin i dtaobh chaiteachas airgid — go gcaithfear ar a laghad dhá mhuirín a bheith ar an mbóthar sul ar féidir deontas a cheadú? Nach bhfuil cosúlacht ann go bhfuil rud éigin mí-cheart anseo, más fíor nach bhfuil ach teach amháin ag fáil deontais.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Bhí £5,600 mar chuid den chaitheachas a cuireadh i gcrích i mbliana i nDún na nGall. An t-iomlán i dtaobh Chontae Dhún na nGall ná £16,600. Caitheadh an tríú cuid de sin ar bhóithre ag a raibh deontais le fáil acu i mí Dheireadh Fómhair agus i mí na Samhna i mbliana. Thug mé freagra beacht ar an cheist beacht a chuir an Teachta Coughlan orm.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Níor thug an tAire freagra ar an cheist a chur mé chuige, nach bhfuil na deontais á gcaitheamh i gceart, nach bhfuil ach muirín amháin ar na bóithre ar caitheadh airgead orthu. Níl sé sin de réir an Achta féin i dtaobh bhóithre áirithe sa Ghaeltacht mar caithfear, ar a laghad, dhá mhuirín a bheith ar na bóithre.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Níl mion-eolas pearsanta agam ar na bóithre faoi leith atá i gceist. Ach ar an cheist atá curtha aige, táim sásta go bhfuil na deontais curtha ar fáil de réir na scéimeanna atá ann. Má tá clámhsán le déanamh ag an Teachta faoi seo, tá slí eile aige chun é féin a shásamh. Tá súil agam nach bhfuil sé ag rá nach cóir na deontais sin a íoc.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Nach bhfuil an tAire in ann chur in iúl don Teach an dóigh ina roghnaíodh na bóithre seo.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Sa gnáth shlí.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Staid na Gaeilge.
MainHeading.P: 2. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an ndearna an Rialtas aon fhiosrúchán le gairid ar staid na Gaeilge sna Gaeltachtaí ar fad agus má rinne an inseoidh sé céard é toradh a gcuid oibre.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Ní dhearnadh aon fhiosrúchán foirmiúil den saghas a luann an Teachta.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Ón eolas atá ag an Aire faoi chúrsaí sna Gaeltachtaí an bhfuil aon tuairim aige an bhfuil dul chun cinn nó laghdú ar labhairt na Gaeilge? Cuirim i gcás, ón eolas atá againn faoin deontas £10 nó eolas eile den chineál sin, ar mbeadh sé in ann tuairim éigin a thabhairt.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Mar is eol don Teacha, chuir Roinn na Gaeltachta ráiteas chuig Comhchoiste Oireachtas na Gaeilge ina bhfuil an Teachta mar Chathaoirleach ar 28 Samhain agus déanann an ráiteás sin cur síos go ginearálta ar staid na Gaeilge. Níl tuilleadh le cur agamsa leis an ráiteas sin.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An é nach bhfuil suim ar bith ag an Aire faoi cén chaoi a bhfuil cúrsai na Gaeilge sna Gaeltachtaí, an bhfuil dul chun cinn nó feabhas? Sin é an rud ba mhaith liom a fháil amach, agus teastaíonn ón phobal go ginearálta an t-eolas céanna i dtaobh cheist labhairt na Gaeilge.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Faoi mar is eol don Teachta, tá an-chuid deacrachtaí ag baint le staid na Gaeilge, fiú sna Gaeltachtaí, agus tá a fhios ag an Teachta faoi na deacrachtaí sin. Mar a dúirt mé, chuir an Roinn ráiteas chuig an comhchoiste a léiríonn na deacrachtaí atá ag an Roinn i dtaobh na nithe sin, agus níl a thuilleadh le cur agamsa leis an ráiteas sin.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Ní thig liom bheith sásta leis an fhreagra a thug an tAire. Tá sé mar dhualgas air, nuair a chuirimse ceist mar seo air go bhfuil daoine ann a bhfuil imní orthu i dtaobh an Gaeilge, fiú amháin ins na Gaeltachtaí, an t-eolas a thabhairt. Caithfidh go bhfuil an t-eolas sa Roinn faoi staid na Gaeilge sna Gaeltachtaí. Muna bhfuil, tá an chosúlacht ann nach bhfuil suim ar bith ag an Aire i dtaobh chúrsaí Gaeilge sna Gaeltachtaí nó nach bhfuil sé sásta an t-eolas a thabhairt dúinn.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Níl a fhios agam cén fáth a deireann an Teachta nach bhfuil aon suim agamsa nó ag Aire na Gaeltachta nó ag Roinn na Gaeltachta i staid na Gaeilge. Chomh cairdiúil agus chomh séimh agus is féidir liom é a rá, thug mé freagra ar an cheist. D'fhiafraigh an Teachta díom an ndearna an Rialtas aon fhiosrúchán le gairid ar staid na Gaeilge sna Gaeltachtaí. Thug mé freagra air sin nár dearnadh aon fhiosrúchán den tsaghas sin.

MainHeading.P: 3. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an léireoidh sé cén dul ar aghaidh atá déanta le moltaí Phlean Gníomhaíochta don Ghaeilge 1983-1986 a chur i gcrích go mór mhór mar a bhaineann sé leis na Ranna Stáit agus le seirbhísí an Stáit.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Tugtar tuairisc faoin dul chun cinn a rinneadh sa dhá bhliain tosaigh den phlean sna tuarascálacha do na blianta 1983-1984 agus 1984-1985 a leagadh faoi bhráid na Dála Samhain 1984 agus Deireadh Fómhair 1985 faoi seach.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: Ní dóigh liom gur chóir d'Aire ar bith freagra mar sin a thabhairt do Theachta a chuireann ceist síos chuig Airí anseo sa Teach. Ceist shimplí a chuir mé síos don Aire faoi cad é an dul chun cinn atá déanta chun moltaí Phlean Gníomhaíochta don Ghaeilge a chur ar aghaidh. Ba mhaith liom cúpla ceist dearfa a chur ar an Aire anois agus go dtabharfadh sé freagra dom. Má thógaimid an chéad mholadh faoin Státseirbhís, lár-ionad forbartha Gaeilge don Stáitseirbhís, coistí forbartha na Gaeilge sna Rannaí Stáit agus oifigeach Gaeilge a bheith tofa i chuile Roinn Stáit. An bhfuil sé sin déanta go fóill?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Mar a dúirt mé cheana, tá dian-chur síos déanta ar na cúrsaí sin, mar shampla, san tuarascáil don bhliain 1984-1985, sa taobh a bhaineann le ranna Stáit agus oifigí Stáit. Tosnaíonn an cur síos ar leathanach 3 den tuarascáil agus críochnaíonn sé ar leathanach 82, má chuirimid san áireamh gach ceann de na rannaí Stáit agus oifigí Stáit: mar shampla, an Chomhairle Ealaíon, Bord na gCapall, boird Stáit and comhlachtaí Stáit, agus tá freagra beacht ar cheist an Teachta tugtha sa tuarascáil sin, agus níl aon eolas níos déanaí ná mar atá san tuarascáil seo le cur agam faoi bhráid na Dála inniu.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: Chuir mé ceist ar an Aire liosta a thabhairt dom de na hoifigí Gaeilge i chuile Roinn Stáit agus comhlachtaí Stáit faoi láthair. An bhféadfadh sé na cinn is déanaí a thabhairt dom má chuirim ceist nó litir chuige, nó an féidir leis iad a thabhairt dom anois?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Bheinn thar a bheith sásta freagra a chur ar fáil don Teachta ó Roinn na Gaeltachta ar na ceisteanna atá aige anseo, ach do mholfainn dó i dtosach báire, chun cur amú ama a sheachaint, an tuarascáil seo a léamh, agus gheobhaidh sé ansin freagra ar an chuid is mó de na ceisteanna a bheadh aige.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Ón eolas atá ag an Aire an dtiocfadh leis a insint dúinn an bhfuil sé sásta leis an dul chun cinn ata á dhéanamh maidir leis na moltaí áta curtha os comhair an Rialtais agus na Ranna Stáit ag Bord na Gaeilge, sé sin ó thaobh labhairt agus úsáid na Gaeilge? An bhféadfaidh an tAire a thuairim féin a thabhairt faoi sin?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Má tá an Teachta ag iarraidh orm mo thuairim féin a thabhairt mar chomhalta den Teach seo agus ní mar Aire na Gaeltachta, ar an mórchóir bheinn sásta go mhaith leis an dul chun cinn atá á dhéanamh ach go bhfuil an-chuid dul cinn gur chóir a dhéanamh as seo amach.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Tionscail Údarás na Gaeltachta.
MainHeading.P: 4. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an dtabharfaidh sé eolas dúinn faoi dhruid mhonarcha GPE in Anagaire, Contae Dhún na nGall, agus an inseoidh sé dhúinn cad é mar a rachaidh druid na monarchan sin i bhfeidhm ar thionscail eile de chuid Udarás na Gaeltachta ar fud na Gaeltachta.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Toisc gur léir nach mbeadh an rath i ndán tionscal de bharr caillteanas leanúnacha a d'eascair as titim i leibhéal na ndíolachán mar gheall ar an gcúlú eacnamaíochta i gcoitinne agus mar gheall ar ghéarchoimhlint sa mhargadh ní raibh dul as ag Údarás na Gaeltachta ach an fhochuideachta atá i gceist a dhúnadh. Tá an tÚdarás sásta nach gcuirfidh dúnadh na monarchan sin isteach ar thionscail eile sa Ghaeltacht.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An nglacfadh an tAire leis nach bhfuair na daoine a bhí ag obair sa mhonarcha seo an redundancy céanna agus a bhfuair na daoine a bhí ag obair i monarchana eile sa Ghaeltacht a dhruid cúpla mí roimhe sin?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Sa chás áirithe seo díoladh leis na hoibrithe na híocaíochtaí iomarcaíochta reachtúla. Mar is eol don Teachta, má bhíonn ceist ar bith íocaíochtaí iomarcaíochta seachas na híocaiochtaí reachtúla a dhéanamh, sin ceist ar leith i ngach comhlacht agus brathann sé ar a bhfuil le fáil.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An nglacann an tAire leis go raibh an chuid is mó de na daoine a bhí ag obair sa mhonarcha seo níos lú ná 40 bliain agus nach bhfuil seans ar bith ag na daoine sin post eile a fháil, agus cad chuige nach raibh an Rialtas sásta airgead iomarcaíochta níos mó a thabhairt dóibh cosúil leis na cásanna eile sa Ghaeltacht agus in áiteanna eile san tír roimhe sin? Seo an chéad mhonarcha sa Ghaeltacht nach bhfuair níos mó airgid ná an t-airgead iomarcaíochta. An nglacann an tAire leis an pointe nach bhfuil seans ar bith ag na daoine seo a bhfuil go leor commitments agus mortgages acu, deireadh a chur leis na commitments sin?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Tá mé ar aon aigne leis an Teachta agus mé ag rá gur mór is agam dúnadh na monarchan seo ach tá reachtaíocht againn sa tír seo chun ceisteanna íocaíochtaí iomarcaíochta a leagan síos. Sa chás seo is é an reachtaíocht seo a chuireadh i bhfeidhm agus is mar bhunlíne atá an reachtaíocht sin againn. Díoladh leis na hoibrithe sin na híocaíochtaí iomarcaíochta reachtúla agus níl cumhacht reachtúil ar bith a chuirfeadh iachall ar éinne íocaíochtaí níos mó ná sin a dhéanamh.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An nglacann an tAire——

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: Níl ach ceithre noiméad fágtha.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Níl an locht ormsa faoi nár tosnaíodh ar 2.30 p.m.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: Bhí mé anseo.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An nglacann an tAire leis gur eisceacht an dúnadh seo agus nach raibh Udarás na Gaeltachta ábalta a bhfiacha go léir a ghlanadh, go háirithe an banc? Ceapaimse go gcuirfidh sé sin isteach go mór ar thionscail eile sa Ghaeltacht nuair nach mbeidh na bainc sásta go mbeidh Údarás na Gaeltachta agus na comhlachtaí ábalta na fiacha go léir a ghlanadh agus gur chuir sé isteach go dtí seo ar thionsclóirí eile sa Ghaeltacht.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Ní ghlacaim leis sin. Iocadh na dliteanais dlithiúla sa chás seo, ag cloí leis an dlí, agus ní ghlacaim leis go gcuirfidh sé isteach ar thionscail Ghaeltachta eile nó ar thionscail neamh-Ghaeltacht eile.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Fostaíocht i dTír Chonaill.
MainHeading.P: 5. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Coughlan Mr. Coughlan
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an bhfuil sé ar intinn ag Údarás na Gaeltachta tuilleadh fostaíochta a chur ar fáil i nGaeltacht Iar-Dheisceart Thír Chonaill.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Bíonn iarrachtaí leanúnacha ar siúl ag Údarás na Gaeltachta d'fhonn tionscail fhiúntacha a aimsiú a chuirfidh deiseanna fostaíochta breise ar fáil sa cheantar sin agus i ngach ceantar Gaeltachta.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An féidir leis an Aire a insint dúinn an méid daoine a bhfuil fostaíocht acu san taobh sin den Ghaeltacht agus an méid daoine a bhfuil iarratais curtha isteach acu le haghaidh jobanna?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Sa mhéid a bhaineann le Gaeltacht iar-dheisceart Dhún na nGall, ar 31 Nollaig 1984 bhí 435 de na fostaithe go lán-aimseartha i dtionscail i gceantair Chill Chártaigh agus Gleann Columchille i gcomparáid le 370 duine bliain roimhe sin, sin méadú 65 sa líon fostaíochta i rith na bliana sin.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Cabhair Do INNIU.
MainHeading.P: 6. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta céard atá á dhéanamh aige le teacht i gcabhair ar fhoilsitheoirí Inniu atá go mór i bhfiacha agus a thuilleann aitheantas ar leith ón Stát de bharr a gcuid oibre ar son na Gaeilge.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: D'íoc Roinn na Gaeltachta ag deireadh na bliana 1984 deontas speisialta £20,000 le foilsitheoirí Inniu mar chabhair dóibh chun fiacha a ghlanadh i dteannta le suim £42,223 ar mhaithe le ceathrar a bhí ag obair ar Inniu le breis agus 27 mbliana. Is oth liom nach bhféadfar tuilleadh cúnaimh a thabhairt dóibh chun na fiacha a bhí orthu ar 30.11.84 a ghlanadh.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An nglacann an tAire leis gur fágadh daoine díomhaoin de bharr nár tugadh deontais do Inniu le leanúint ar aghaidh agus go bhfuil comhlacht ann a bhí ag brath go mór ar na deontais — sé sin FNT — agus go bhfuil baol ann go gcaillfidh 20 duine a gcuid postanna más rud é nach bhfuil cabhair le fáil ón Rialtas; agus ó tharla an obair íontach a rinne na daoine a bhí i mbun Inniu ar feadh na mblianta don Ghaeilge, go bhfuil cás speisialta anseo agus go mba cheart do Roinn na Gaeltachta agus don Rialtas athbhreithniú a dhéanamh ar an scéal arís le teacht i gcabhair ar na daoine seo ag súil go mbeidh siad in ann leanúint ar aghaidh leis an obair thábhachtach atá á déanamh acu le foilsitheoireacht i nGaeilge agus freisin mar aisíoc ar an méid a rinne siad don Ghaeilge i gcaitheamh na mblianta?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Chomh fada agus is féidir liom a chomhaireamh tá dhá cheist ansin. Sa mhéid a bhaineann leis an gcéad cheist níl a fhios agam ar thuig mé go beacht——

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: Dhá cheist agus scéal fada.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Ní bheidh mise ró-fhada. Chomh fada agus a bhaineann leis an gcéad cheist, níl a fhios agam ar thuig mé go beacht cad a bhí an Teachta Gallagher ag rá. Más é an rud é go raibh sé ag iarraidh orm dhá mbeadh deontas Stáit le fáil ag an gcomhlacht atá anois i gCathair na Mart — sin ceist atá go hiomlán ar thaobh na ceiste atá faoin ár mbráid anois. Níl a fhios agam go beacht an í sin an cheist a chuir an Teachta ach más ea caithfidh mé a rá nach bhfuil aon phlean againn deontas ar bith a chur ar fáil do chomhlacht nach bhfuil ag fáil deontais faoi láthair.

Sa mhéid a bhaineann leis an dara ceist, tá aithne pearsanta agam féin ar chuid de na daoine atá i gceist anseo. Tá aithne pearsanta agam le blianta anuas ar an obair a bhí á déanamh acu. Caithfidh mé a rá áfach go raibh rabhadh ag an muintir i gceist go raibh deireadh ag teacht leis an deontas. Fuair muintir Inniu scéal ó Roinn na Gaeltachta i Mí Feabhra 1984 go mbeadh deireadh leis an deontas taréis 24 Lúnasa 1984.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An nglacann an tAire leis go raibh deacrachtaí ag an gcomhlacht maidir le áit a bhí ar cíos acu agus go gcaithfidh siad seasamh leis an gconradh maidir leis an gcíos a bhí ar an áras sin i Sráid Uí Chonaill agus go bhfuil deacrachtaí acu chomh maith leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim agus dá bhrí sin go mba cheart an scéal a athbhreithniú le teacht i gcabhair ar na daoine seo más féidir é.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Glacaim leis go bhfuil deacrachtaí ann den tsaghas a luaigh an Teachta Gallagher. Ní féidir liom glacadh leis go bhfuil cúis ansin an scéal a athbhreithniú nuair a chuireamar é sin go léir san áireamh ar an gcéad lá.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Tree Felling Applications.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Andrews Mr. D. Andrews
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he is aware that a number of further tree felling applications are being sought by a developer at Dorney Court, Shankill, County Dublin, and the action, if any, he intends taking in the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. D'Arcy) Michael D'Arcy
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. D'Arcy)
Speaker.P: My Department are at present examining three applications by the developer for felling licences in respect of 27 trees at Dorney Court, Shankill, County Dublin. While felling licences are not required in respect of 22 of the trees as they are standing within 100 feet of a building, no decision will be taken on the applications until Dublin County Council as the local planning authority have furnished their observations on amenity aspects of the proposed felling.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. MacSharry Mr. MacSharry
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the present position regarding the dredging of Burtonport harbour, County Donegal, and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: My Department are committed to the dredging of Burtonport harbour and its approach channel. Every effort will be made to have the work included in the 1986 fishery harbour works programme subject to the availability of funds in the light of works carried on from the current year and new works already committed for 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Can the Minister give any commitment as to when finance for this programme will be available and can he tell us also the percentage grant that Roinn na Gaeltachta will provide and also where the extra moneys will come from?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I cannot give full commitment. I can only answer the question in the light of the works carried out in the current year and those in respect of which there is a commitment in 1986. If moneys are available the work will be done. On the question of the grants, my Department will put up 75 per cent while Donegal County Council are being requested to provide the remaining 25 per cent.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: As the person responsible for this area, can the Minister advise the House as to what is the position regarding the commitment given a few years ago by the Government whereby 50 per cent would have been provided by the Department of Fisheries and 50 per cent by Roinn na Gaeltachta?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: That commitment was given in 1982 but Roinn na Gaeltachta failed to provide their 50 per cent portion. A decision was taken by my Department to request the county council to provide 25 per cent and the conditions were changed with the Department providing 75 per cent. That arrangement stands.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: In view of the difficult financial circumstances in local authorities, would the Minister do his utmost to impress on Roinn na Gaeltachta the necessity to provide the other 25 per cent in order to ensure that the moneys are made available immediately?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I will take up the Deputy's request but I cannot give any guarantee that my efforts will be successful.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Howth (Dublin) Fish Auction Hall.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Cosgrave Mr. M. Cosgrave
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry when moneys will be made available to erect the fish auction hall at Howth harbour.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The provision of an auction hall at Howth has been under consideration in the context of the development scheme for the harbour. However, in view of the very substantial expenditure by my Department on Howth harbour in recent years and the need to allocate the funds available as equitably as possible on the basis of the most urgent and pressing fishery harbour works throughout the country, it has not been possible to proceed with the auction hall at Howth. In view of present fishery harbour work commitments, I am not in a position at this stage to say when a financial allocation for the project can be made.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Dublin Fish Market.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. T. Leonard Mr. T. Leonard
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he has any proposals for the development of the Dublin Fish Market and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: Dublin Corporation and the authority responsible for the maintenance and operation of the Dublin Fish Market and I have no direct functions in the matter. In the interest of the fishing industry, however, I am arranging to take up with the corporation shortly the question as to what measures can be taken by the corporation to improve the facilities at the market.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Can the Minister indicate whether he visited the market recently and can he give an outline of the changes he would consider necessary in order to modernise conditions there?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I spent a morning at the market, from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m., to see for myself how the market functions. I was very disappointed at the condition of the place. Hygiene conditions there are very much substandard. It is not for me to decide the changes that are required there but the place is in need of a fundamental overhaul. I have contacted Dublin Corporation with a view to their improving the condition of the market.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Can the Minister indicate whether he will be providing some funding to enable the work he considers necessary to be carried out and can he give any indication also of what his priorities in this matter are?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The matter is not within the responsibility of my Department.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: But will the Minister provide the funds to enable the necessary works to be undertaken?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: There are no funds available for such works so far as my Department are concerned.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Why, then, did the Minister visit the market?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The market is used also for the sale of fruit and vegetables by the people of the area and the responsibility for improving the conditions rests with the corporation.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Would the Minister accept that the Department have some responsibility in relation to the way in which fish is distributed and presented for sale? He has seen for himself that the state of the market leaves much to be desired. Is it not for him to take some initiative by way of trying to bring about an improvement in conditions there? I raised this question a long time ago but my efforts were knocked by all sides in the House.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I have taken the initiative of visiting the market and following that visit I contacted the responsible authority who are Dublin Corporation, but I have not yet received a reply from them to my representations.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Can the Minister give any indication of what he considers should be done to bring about the desired conditions? Is he prepared, for instance, to back up his visit with some financial assistance so that some worthwhile work might be done at the market? If the Minister cannot give any such commitment, his visit will have been no more than a public relations exercise.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: Dublin Corporation impose a charge on everyone who operates in the market and it is a matter for the corporation to make arrangements regarding the finances that are necessary to allow the necessary works to be carried out there. We have no function in the matter of financing in this respect.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - EC Timber Policy.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Browne Mr. J. Browne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the progress, if any, which has been made on the development of a common timber policy for the EC and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: If the Deputy is referring to the formulation by the EC of a common forestry policy the position is that no such proposals are under consideration at present. Nevertheless, various forestry measures have been initiated from time to time on an ad hoc basis, for example, the forestry element of the Western Package in Council Regulation (EEC) No. 1820/80 and in the recent amendment of the Structural Directive in Agriculture, certain measures to encourage afforestation by farmers have been included. Discussions have taken place in the Community on a draft Council resolution proposed by the Commission in 1983 for a Community action programme regarding forestry and forest-based industries. The draft resolution is still under examination by COREPER — the Committee of Permanent Representatives — and discussions on it have not reached the stage where one could say what the outcome may be. However, I shall keep the matter under review and press for progress at every opportunity.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: What is the Irish input to date into the action programme initiated in 1983? Have we made submissions? Have we detailed what we feel is necessary in this area and can the Minister give us an indication of the priorities?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: That is not included in the brief, but I understand that the Department have made a submission. It seems that the committees are on an ad hoc basis and do not seem to complete their work. We are pressing for something to be done in respect of forestry and the Government are giving consideration to certain proposals. When those proposals are completed and decisions are taken, we will go back to the EC. It would be premature to go back sooner.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Tree Felling Licences.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the number of tree felling licences issued by his Department in 1983, 1984 and 1985 and if the conditions applying to these orders are being complied with.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The following were the number of tree felling licences issued in the year in question:

MainHeading.P: These licences are monitored by local forestry staff of my Department to ensure that the conditions attached to the licences are complied with.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: What are the general conditions in relation to the licences? Is there a condition that trees be planted to make up for the ones cut down?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: There is such a condition but certain licences are granted to allow for land reclamation. Where trees are felled for land reclamation the licences will state that.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Is the Minister satisfied that the licences are being complied with?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: Yes.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Inver (Donegal) Pier Improvement Works.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Coughlan Mr. Coughlan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry when it is intended to have improvement works carried out to the port pier, Inver, County Donegal; the cost of the proposed work; the percentage of the cost being borne by the Department; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: In general, a development scheme for a fishery harbour must be justified on the basis of its economic assessment. As the cost of the improvement scheme proposed for port pier, Inver, was difficult to justify on economic grounds in present circumstances, my Department are currently reappraising the whole project with a view to drawing up a modified scheme that will be economically justifiable and meet the needs of the fishermen. Up to 75 per cent of the cost of such a scheme would be met by my Department.
I am arranging for officers of my Department to meet with representatives of the local fishermen to discuss the problem.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: If the Department of the Environment decide after reappraising the situation that it would not, in their terms, be economically viable, although it is even at the moment economically viable for small fishermen, where do the fishermen obtain a grant to carry out the very necessary repairs?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The Deputy is assuming that my Department will say that it is not economically viable. I doubt if that will happen. I understand that a couple of schemes are prepared and they were asked to reduce the cost of one which they did. I have no reason to believe that my Department will turn it down.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: I take it that the Minister is confident. When does the Minister expect that all the reassesments will be carried out and can he give a commitment to the House about it?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I cannot give a commitment but I have asked the officials to meet the fishermen concerned in that harbour. There will be no delay in respect of my Department. Once discussions take place, assessments will be made and a scheme will be put forward for approval by the Department of Finance.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he has any proposals under consideration for the conservation of pike in selected areas and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: Arising from a review of the coarse fishing bye-laws carried out by my Department in consultation with the central and regional fishery boards certain proposals for the conservation of pike are at present under consideration in the Department. I hope to be in a position to take a decision on these proposals in the near future.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Do the proposals relate to certain areas?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: What we have in mind is to restrict the quantity of pike which visitors may take home with them.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister is not proposing to move in on any particular locality or region?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: There are no such proposals. The restriction on the catches is the main proposal.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Fish Processing Industry.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the measures, if any, the Government intend to take to promote the development of a fish processing industry in this country.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: There has already been significant development of the fish processing industry in this country, particularly in the past five years, during which period 152 projects with a total fixed asset investment of £36.4 million were approved for State aid amounting to £10.3 million. It is the policy of the Government to encourage and promote the continued development of the industry in every way possible.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: Will the Minister agree that in 1984 we exported 90,000 tonnes of chilled or frozen fish worth approximately £39 million? Is the Minister aware that had this 90,000 tonnes of fish been processed to the consumer stage, it would have added approximately £2,000 per tonne to the value which would have amounted to £150 million or £160 million, in addition to all the jobs that would have been created?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: A large quantity of unprocessed fish was exported but the market trends demanded this. There is no sense in processing fish if we have not the market for them. I am more interested in getting the markets right first and then processing can follow. We are concentrating on getting the markets right at the moment.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: Surely the Minister is aware that we imported £40 million of processed fish and that there is a market here for processed fish although other nations can market their frozen fish here and in Britain. Why can we not market processed fish?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: It is incorrect that we imported £40 million worth of processed fish. The figure is £23 million worth. That is made up of fish fingers and that type of product ——

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: What is wrong with fish fingers?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: ——which are not produced here.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: Why not? That is the point.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I cannot talk for the private sectore but numerous firms have attempted to make fish fingers and failed. I cannot answer for the private sector.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: It is the Minister's job.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: Is the Minister aware that at a recent ANUGA food fair in Germany there were 14 halls of food on exhibition and one large hall showed huge quantities of processed fish and all the fish had been caught in Irish waters and exported? What action do the Minister's Department propose to take to correct this situation? We are exporting all of our raw materials instead of having the added value that would accrue were it processed at home.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I accept that the marketing of fish was somewhat neglected over the last number of years. I have attempted to rectify that situation but it cannot be done overnight. In respect of processed fish, there is no point in processing the fish unless we have the markets available. In respect of the query by Deputy O'Keeffe about raw material being bought in Ireland and processed in other countries, that is happening but there is little we can do about it. It is better to have it bought here and processed in other countries than have it dumped in the sea. The amount of herrings dumped in 1981-82 was somewhere in the region of 9,000 or 10,000 tonnes.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Is the Minister aware that tourist interests are very worried about the wholesale clearing out of pike, particularly by French tourists, for processing in Europe? Would he accept that a deputation I met from Belturbet, County Cavan, last Sunday night, expressed genuine fears in this regard and that this is a matter which needs remedying?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: Restrictions will be brought in in respect of pike——

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: When?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: My understanding is that is will be very shortly. The regulations are being examined in order to impose restrictions on the catching of pike.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister gave some figures for the number of projects which had been approved. The Minister will be aware that, even though some of those projects have been approved, a very high percentage of them have not been undertaken. Has he any plans to ensure that projects which have been approved for processing are undertaken? Would he use his initiative to ensure that they are undertaken?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: Improving the overall market situation will improve——

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: I am talking about projects which have been approved but have not been undertaken.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I am not aware of that; I do not know. According to my information here, 152 projects with a total fixed asset investment of £34.4 million were approved for State aid amounting to £10.3 million.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: How many have actually been carried out to date?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I will get the information and supply it to the Deputy.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: Has the Minister a policy for promoting and encouraging the processing of fish or is he leaving it to other Ministers, the Minister for Industry, Trade, Commerce and Tourism or whoever, to do the job for him? What policy has the Minister for encouraging the IDA, private interests or whoever to become involved in the fish processing industry?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: We have a policy which is being followed through. Part of that policy has been the establishment of a fish advisory marketing committee which I chair myself. That committee is comprised of officials from the Department of Industry, Trade, Commerce and Tourism, officials of my Department and of An Bord Iascaigh Mhara, and all the fishing interests. That committee have been in existence two and a half years and have been quite successful in securing markets for processed fish. I should say that the main focus is on processed fish. We have just landed a very good contract on the Canadian market with a Dublin firm. Once that firm had signed the contract for the fish they could take on 20 extra people the following day. The contract is for six different species of fish, all processed fish. We are at present examining the American market, which is very lucrative, and we are hopeful to make a breakthrough there in the next two or three months. The Canadian, American and German markets are the main ones involved in the buying of fish. This is the first time the entire industry has been represented around the same table. Therefore we are getting our information from the industry itself.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - State Forestry Planting Programme.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the total area of land planted in 1983, 1984 and 1985 under the State planting programme and the area of this which is reforestation.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: As the information requested is in the form of a tabular statement, I propose to circulate it in the Official Report.

MainHeading.P: Following is the statement:

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Ahern Mr. M. Ahern
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he has any proposals for the holding of inquiries for the determination of areas for the issue of aquaculture licences and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: To date public inquiries have been held in nine areas with a view to designating them as areas within which it shall be lawful to engage in aquaculture subject to licence. In two of the nine areas designation orders have been made and the process of licensing has commenced. In the remaining seven areas consultations have been continuing with environmental and industry interests in order to reach agreement as to the extent to which aquaculture may proceed without conflict with these and other interests. A substantial measure of agreement has now been reached. I am hopeful that it will be possible soon to proceed with the designation of further areas for licensing.

A number of other suitable areas have been identified and I expect that, subject to consultation with other interests, preparations can be put in train at an early stage for the holding of public inquiries in these areas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: There is here a huge potential for jobs and revenue if the Minister would use some inititive to get these projects under way. What effort is the Minister now making to ensure some development in this whole area, which is in decline? For example, has the Minister any plans to establish an aquaculture unit within his Department to deal specifically with these applications?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: We are awaiting the announcement of the White Paper on Fisheries which is expected within the next fortnight. Once that has been announced, then we shall set up a committee——

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister does not need any White Paper.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: We are talking about policy. It is the job of the Government to examine policies and make certain recommendations. I cannot run along in front of the Government. I must await these recommendations. There is also a White Paper before the Government which is important. Once the White Paper has been announced I can get on with the job.

Speaker.hpid: Tomás Mac Giolla Tomás Mac Giolla
Speaker.P: Is there any truth in the rumour that the Minister intends to sell off the fish farming projects within his control?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I have no information in that regard. It is purely speculation.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Christmas Tree Trade.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Andrews Mr. D. Andrews
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he is aware of the shortage of the non-shed noblis fir tree to the Irish Christmas tree trade and that the variety is alleged to be imported in large numbers; if he will explain the distribution procedure to the trade; the number of distributors; the areas of distribution; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I am aware that the demand for Christmas trees is greater than the noblis fir available supply this year.

Of the total — 140,000 Christmas trees on offer this year only about 15 per cent 20,000 — are noblis fir, the balance being mainly Norway spruce which has been the traditional Christmas tree in Ireland and some lodgepole pine which is also growing in popularity.

MainHeading.P: My information is that to date there have been no licences issued for the importation of noblis fir Christmas trees.

My Department distributes Christmas trees from forest centres throughout the country (a) by way of tender sale (b) through direct sales at fixed prices to regular and new customers and (c) through sales at forests to meet local demands.

My Department have taken steps to increase the supply of noblis fir Christmas trees in order to meet market demand but the Deputy will appreciate that it takes up to eight years to produce Christmas trees of an acceptable size. It is my policy to encourage production of Christmas trees of all species for which a market exists or can be promoted.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Ahern Mr. M. Ahern
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he had been consulted regarding proposals for limiting the power of regional fishery boards in the prosecution of cases for water pollution and if he will make a statement on the matter

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: As a indicated by the Minister for the Environment in reply to a question in the House on 7 November, this matter is currently under consideration. My views as well as those others interests covered will be taken into account before a final decision is made.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Does the Minister realise that the Central Fisheries Board, which is specifically charged with responsibility with regard to fish, should have a role to play in the control of water pollution, seeing that the local authorities, for the most part, have much wider responsibilities and cannot concentrate on that aspect of their duties?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: Any comment I could make would be purely a personal one. I am inclined to avoid doing so at present. I appreciate that there are very serious problems in the Deputy's area in respect of water pollution in regard to who should and who should not be responsible. I would prefer to wait until a decision has been taken and discussions have been completed before commenting on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: I would ask the Minister not to wait too long, that is all.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Exploratory Fishing Projects.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Walsh Mr. J. Walsh
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he has any proposals for new exploratory fishing projects in 1986 and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: It is the intention of An Bord Iascaigh Mhara to continue the exploratory fishing and gear technology programmes aimed at assisting the fleet to work in new deep water white fish grounds and developing fisheries for pelagic species not subject to quota restrictions. The Exchequer funds allocated to BIM provide for these programmes.
The specific projects to be undertaken in 1986 have yet to be finalised.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Shannon District Fishery Protection Vessel.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he will sanction proposals from the Shannon Regional Fisheries Board for the provision of a fishery protection vessel for the Shannon District.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The question of the provision of a protection vessel for the Shannon Regional Fisheries Board is at present under consideration by my Department as well as similar requests from other regional fisheries boards.

To enable me to assess the requirements of all the fisheries boards in this matter I have asked the Central Fisheries Board to make a comprehensive examination of numbers, types and costs of vessels required by the various boards for salmon fishery protection work. I am at present awaiting the Central Fisheries Board's report on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. MacSharry Mr. MacSharry
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he is aware of the difficulties being experienced by fishermen due to reduced fish quotas and the steps he proposes to take to overcome this problem.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: With the exception of one or two species where the quotas have been reduced slightly, quotas generally have either remained at a constant level or have increased slightly over the last couple of years. My colleague, Deputy O'Toole, Minister for Fisheries and Forestry, is at present attending a Council of Fisheries Ministers in Brussels and he will be endeavouring in the course of negotiations to secure the maximum quotas possible for our fishermen, particularly in the case of mackerel where the EC Commission has proposed reductions for 1986 having regard to the scientific advice available.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: While the Minister of State maintains that the fish quotas might remain constant, the most important which constitutes 60 per cent of fish landings, that of mackerel, was reduced last year from 85,000 to 80,000 tonnes. Will he accept that this reduction cannot be accepted, that it is preventing the development of the industry in an already depressed part of the country? What efforts are the Government making to ensure that we get increased quotas and not reduced or constant quotas?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: As I explained in the answer, my Minister, Deputy O'Toole, is in Brussels negotiating this quota and I hope that he can have a good outturn at those negotiations.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: This is a final supplementary.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Politicians on this side of the House have been blamed this week for not securing sufficient quotas. Would the Minister of State accept that the basis of the Hague agreement of 1976 is of absolutely no advantage to us now? It suggested that quotas would double but this has not happened.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The Hague agreement was one of the best agreements the fishermen in this country ever got. The terms of the agreement were to the benefit of the fishing industry here as a whole. The situation in respect of mackerel is serious and I hope at this stage that the reduction here will not be too great.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: This is a final supplementary.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Is the Minister of State aware that the catch of mackerel has decreased by about 20,000 tonnes since he went into office? In 1982 the mackerel catch was in the region of 100,000 tonnes and this year it will be 86,000 tonnes. Does the Minister of State seriously expect us to believe that we can get any adequate increase with the attitude he has been adopting in the last few days?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I do not accept that it has decreased by 20,000 tonnes since we came into office.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: I ask him to give the figures for the last four years.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I have the catch figures for 1984 and 1985 and the proposals for 1986. In 1984 we had 85,000 tonnes and in 1985 we had 80,000 tonnes and we got 6,000 further tonnes from the British making the total 86,400 tonnes.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: What was the catch in 1982-83?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I have not got those figures.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: We are getting selected figures.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: As it is now after 3.30 p.m., in accordance with an Order of the House I must move to priority questions.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: On a point of order, is it in order that the Department of Fisheries and Forestry and the Department of the Gaeltacht, who have limited enough time, should have suffered a loss of eight minutes because the Government were not present? Can you not extend that time now?

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: No, I am sorry. Ceist 26.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Forestry Review Group.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry if he will make a statement on the report of the forestry review group and the action, if any, he proposes to take on the report.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The report of the review group on forestry was published on Wednesday, 11 December 1985 and a copy was circulated to each Member of the Oireachtas. The report will now be examined by my Department in consultation with other Departments and interested parties prior to the detailed consideration of the recommendations by the Government.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Can we get some indication from the Minister of State as to whether the Government propose to take some action on the review group report or will this join the other proposals in the Department dealing with every aspect of development? We have had a number of reports on forestry and most of the information contained in the recent one was already published by the Department and revised in 1983. Can we get some indication from the Minister of State as to what action he proposes to take, or will any action be taken, on the findings of the group?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: It is hoped that the Government will give this report full consideration in about March or April 1986. That is my understanding from the Minister's timetable.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Is the Minister of State aware that the State planting programme at present is in decline? It has not reached its objectives and in the review group report which has been published there is no indication whatever that the group or even the Department wish to move in the direction of increasing planting targets. Is he further aware that the review group also envisage a very low financial priority for the Department in future? What action does he hope to take to deal with these two areas, the revision of the planting targets to increase the number of acres under plantation and the provision of finances to enable them to do the job?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: To say that the programme is in decline is incorrect. It is not in decline.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: It is in decline. Half the target this year——

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: This year we planted 7,000 hectares.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: How much reafforestation was in that?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: About 1,300 hectares.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: You planted 5,000——

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: As with fisheries, if a report is available it is up to the Government who make the decisions to make their assessment of the report and make recommendations. The same applies to forestry as to the fisheries. I cannot run in front of a decision made by the Government. This is a very valuable report containing very good recommendations and it is up to the Government to make decisions in respect of those recommendations.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Fisheries and Forestry the steps he proposes to take to secure an adequate mackerel quota for the 1986 season.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The mackerel quota to be allocated to Ireland and other member states in 1986 is being discussed at the Council of Fisheries Ministers currently in progress in Brussels in the overall context of total allowable catches and quotas for 1986. Deputy O'Toole, Minister for Fisheries and Forestry, is attending the Council where he is pressing for an adequate mackerel quota for Ireland. He has already made strong representations to the Commission in the matter during the course of a special visit to Brussels on Monday 9 December 1985.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister of State will be aware that the Commission are proposing to reduce the quota to 62,500 tonnes. Can he give us any indication of what quota we are seeking at present in the negotiations and of what case is being made to substantiate that?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I am well aware of the proposal by the Commission for 60,000 tonnes. Unfortunately, we are all very much aware of that. On the second question, I have already stated that the Minister is pushing for the mackerel quota for the fishermen of this State.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Does the Minister of State realise the seriousness of the situation? If the Commission and the Council go ahead with the proposal to reduce the quota to 62,500 tonnes it will mean financial ruin for many people involved in mackerel fishing and also losses of hundreds of jobs in processing. Can we get some indication from the Minister of State as to what figure the Minister is demanding as our quota for 1986? Is it 80,000 tonnes, 100,000 tonnes? Will he keep in mind the fact that the catch has reduced by 20,000 tonnes in the past two years?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: It would be most unwise for me to start pegging figures around and damaging the Minister's prospects. He is over there on the spot. As Deputy Daly knows from being a Minister over there you talk to your colleagues and see what the prospects are. I am not over there and it would be very unwise of me even to mention a figure in this House. We are pushing for the maximum tonnage of mackerel for the fishermen of this State.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P. Gallagher Mr. P. Gallagher
Speaker.P: The Minister of State said that we should not get increased quotas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Let me impress on the Minister of State the urgency of the situation. There is total chaos now in the mackerel industry, much of which has been brought about by the actions of the Minister.

Speaker.hpid: An Ceann Comhairle Thomas J. (Cavan) Fitzpatrick
Speaker.P: That is a statement. We cannot have a discussion.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: That is total nonsense.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The implementation of the quotas has been managed by the Department and the Minister. Can we get an indication from the Minister of State that they will take this matter seriously enough? When does he hope to have a decision on it?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: The Government are taking this very seriously and every effort is being made to secure the maximum quota and tonnage of mackerel for our fishermen.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Will the Minister of State accept that the whole saga of quotas makes a mockery of the Hague agreement, that we are not getting the rights we were supposed to be guaranteed on that occasion, and that the situation seems to deteriorate from year to year?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D'Arcy Mr. D'Arcy
Speaker.P: I do not accept that. If we had not the Hague agreement our position to day would be much worse.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Labhairt na Gaeilge.
MainHeading.P: 28. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an aontódh sé, cé go bhfuil tromlach phobal na tíre báúil le labhairt na Gaeilge, go bhfuil an chosúlacht ann gur ag dul in olcas atá cúrsaí maidir le labhairt na teanga agus an mbeadh sé sásta a mholadh don Rialtas treoir a thabhairt le misneach an phobail a mhúscailt lena chur ina luí orthu go bhfuil gá le hiarracht speisialta leis an tseoid is luachmhaire dár n-oidhreacht a thabhairt slán agus an dtabharfaidh sé ráiteas sa chás.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Glacaim leis go bhfuil tromlach phobal na tíre báúil leis an nGaeilge agus glacfaidh an Teachta leis, ceapaim, ní foláir, go gcaithfear an bhá sin a shaothrú i gcaoi go mbeidh fonn ar an bpobal iarracht leanúnach a dhéanamh chun úsáid na Gaeilge mar theanga labhartha a leathadh. Ní dóigh liom, áfach, gur ag dul in olcas atá cúrsaí — tá comharthaí dóchais ann freisin.

Faoi mar is eol don Teachta, dhearbhaigh an Rialtas nuair a bhí an Plean Gníomhaíochta don Ghaeilge 1983-86 á chur i láthair an phobail go bhfuil de chúram orthu timpeallacht a chruthú a thacóidh dáiríre leosan a roghnaíonn an Ghaeilge mar phríomhtheanga nó mar theanga bhunúsach ina saol laethúil. Beifear sásta aon deis réasúnta a thapú chun an pobal a spreagadh le húsáid na Gaeilge a chur chun cinn.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Nuair a cuireadh cláir phoiblíochta ar bun ar an teilifís, “Part of what we are”— chuidigh siad go mór le labhairt na Gaeilge. Ach ní raibh aon leanúnachas leis agus níl an t-airgead nó an cuidiú ata ag teastáil ó Bhord na Gaeilge chun an leanunachas sin a chothú agus suim na ndaoine a mhúscailt i gceart.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Tá airgead le fáil ag Bord na Gaeilge ón Rialtas chomh fada agus is féidir é sin a fháil laistigh de na teorainneacha atá ann faoi láthair. Aontóinn leis an Teachta, agus ceapaim go n-aontódh Aire na Gaeltachta liom freisin go raibh tionchar an-mhór ag an chlár a luaigh an Teachta ar mheon munitir na tíre agus is ábhar díomá dom agus don Aire nach mbaintear níos mó usáide as an ghléas teilifise chun an meon seo a spreagadh níos mó ná mar atá.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An n-aontodh an tAire go bhfuil gá le teilifís Gaeltachta agus i bhfad níos mó cláracha trí Ghaeilge at RTE chun an teanga a chur chun cinn.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Ba mhaith liomsa i bhfad níos mó cláracha as Gaeilge a fheiceáil. Mar gheall ar chúrsaí theilifís Gaeltachta, sin ábhar go bhféadfaimís a phlé sa Teach ar ocáid eile.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Ó tharla go bhfuil suim ag an Aire i ndul chun cinn na Gaeilge, an bhfuil sé sásta go mba cheart don Rialtas brú a chur ar RTE na cláracha a chur chun cinn ar mhaithe le pobal na Gaeltachta agus na Gaeilge. Ag breathnú ar na Teachtaí trasna, bheadh faitíos orm aontú leis an Teachta gur chóir domsa nó aon Aire eile brú a chur ar RTE.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions Oral Answers. - Deontais do Cheantair Iargúlta.
MainHeading.P: 29. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an bhfuil a fhios aige gur ábhar imní do phobal na Gaeltachta an ráiteas ón Aire Tionscail, Trádála, Tráchtála agus Turasóireachta go gcuirfear deireadh leis na deontais bhreise atá á bhfáil ag na ceantair iargúlta le tionscail a bhunú agus an inseoidh sé an mbeidh an treoir chéanna á tabhairt maidir le deontais a bheas á gcur ar fáil ag Údarás na Gaeltachta.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Níl sé beartaithe laghdú a dhéanamh ar na rátaí deontais a bhíonn le fáil ó Údarás na Gaeltachta ar mhaithe le tionscail i gceantair Ghaeilge.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An bhfuil a fhios ag an Aire go bhfuil imní ar dhaoine de bharr an ráitis nach mbeidh aon cheist ach go mbeidh laghdú feasta ar na deontais a bhí le fáil le haghaidh tionscal sna ceantair iargúlta? An n-aontódh sé gur stop sé sin daoine ag dul isteach sa Ghaeltacht le tionscail a bhunú ar mhaithe le muintir na Gaeltachta?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Ní aontaím. Má léann an Teachta an ráiteas atá i gceist aige feicfidh sé nach bhfuil ceist ar bith i dtaobh ísliú deontais in áit ar bith, agus go háirithe nach bhfuil ceist ar bith faoi rátaí deontais a gceantair Ghaeltachta a laghdú.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Gaeltacht the purpose of a recent visit by himself and officials of two Departments and other agencies to Finland; the dates of departure and return; the total number of officials and others in the party; the total cost involved; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Thug mé féin agus toscaireacht ón tír seo cuairt ar an bhFionlainn ó 14-20 Meán Fómhair ar chuireadh oifigiúil ó Rialtas na Fionlainne. Bhain an turas go príomha le cúrsaí foraoiseachta agus le hiarrachtaí chun tionsclóirí a mhealladh le tionscail fhiúntacha a bhunú sa Ghaeltacht.
B'fhiú go mór an turas ó thaobh na foraoiseachta de agus gnothaíodh suas le 60 post nua don Ghaeltacht dá bharr agus tá togra eile idir chamáin fós.

Bhí 7 nduine sa toscaireacht oifigiúil agus 4 eile linn a bhfuil saintaithí acu ar na cúrsaí a bhí á bplé. D'íoc an dá Roinn atá faoi mo chúram agus Údarás na Gaeltachta suim £9,460 san iomlán i ndáil leis an turas. Níl an costas a bhain le sciurdeitleán an Rialtais san áireamh san fhigiúr sin.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Will the Minister tell the House the purpose of this junket? We are aware that two Departments were involved and that a number of officials from them and from Údarás na Gaeltachta and the IDA went. What was the outcome of the junket? Was it necessary?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: Turas an-tábhachtach agus an-úsáideach a bhí ann. Mar a dúirt mé cúpla noiméad ó shin — b'fhéidir nach raibh an Teachta ag éisteacht — cuireadh tús le 60 post nua sa Ghaeltacht dá bharr agus tá togra eile idir chamáin. Má tá liosta de na tograí ag teastáil ón Teachta cuirfidh mé an liosta chuige.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Níor luaigh an tAire an costas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Dukes Mr. Dukes
Speaker.P: D'íoc an dá Roinn agus Údarás na Gaeltachta £9,460 san iomlán ar an turas.

MainHeading.Title: Private Notice Question. - Threatened B & I Strike.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. B. Ahern Mr. B. Ahern
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the action he has taken, or proposes to take, to avert the B & I strike, due to commence on Friday next; and if the Labour Court have yet invited both sides to talks in an effort to avoid the disruption to the travel plans of 40,000 people over the Christmas holiday.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: I can understand and, indeed I share the Deputy's concern having regard to the seasonal time of the year but the requirements of time in giving notice for a Private Notice Question have probably overtaken events in respect of the Deputy's question. I am sure the Deputy is aware that the Labour Court have intervened and that conciliation talks started at 10.30 a.m. Those talks are continuing. I know the Deputy, the Fianna Fáil spokesman on Labour and the Public Service, will be as anxious as I am to ensure that no action that the House may take at this stage prejudices the outcome of these talks.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. B. Ahern Mr. B. Ahern
Speaker.P: As I mentioned last week when I raised the matter of the CIE dispute, I do not have any desire to prejudge any talks at the Labour Court but, unfortunately, some talks wind up as soon as we stop talking with the result that one does not get anywhere. I should like to ask the Minister if he will accept that this is one of the most serious strikes threatened here in many years and that if it takes place it will cause great difficulties for tourism and trade? It will cause major disruption for the many families who have had to emigrate this year. In 1985 we have had the highest emigration since the fifties and the Minister's Department must be acutely aware of the thousands of Irish people who are working throughout Europe and are anxious to return for Christmas using the B & I service. Will the Minister indicate the action he intends to take in the next few days, apart from the talks at the Labour Court?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Quinn Mr. Quinn
Speaker.P: The House will recognise that the difficulties that have arisen in a number of areas which have manifested themselves as industrial relations problems are ones that have had a long history with rights and wrongs on both sides. Those difficulties are now in the hands of professional negotiators representing management and the unions. The House, and Deputy Ahern, will recognise that we have in the Labour Court a very professional team of skilled negotiators whose full time job is that of industrial relations. Like my predecessors I regard it as my duty to ensure that the machinery for industrial relations is at all times available, properly resourced and kept constantly aware of the concern of the public that it does the job entrusted to it. There is a very understandable temptation on behalf of all public representatives to try to replace that machinery. They do so, I suggest, at their peril. In recognition of the legitimate concern of Deputy Ahern and the service he has done in raising the matter I should like to tell the Deputy that the action he has sought has taken place. The Labour Court have intervened and conciliation talks commenced at 10.30 this morning. All we can usefully do is to underline the concern of Members to see a satisfactory outcome to those talks. I suggest, with all due respect to the Member opposite, that anything further at this stage could be counterproductive.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. B. Ahern Mr. B. Ahern
Speaker.P: We hope the talks will be successful. As it is, we are going very shortly into recess. Could the Minister give an undertaking to make a statement-about the matter in the House? I might not get another opportunity over the next two days to raise this matter as the House will sit for only 48 hours more. If the strike has not been averted, will he give an undertaking to make such a statement to the House, so that we can further debate it?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Quinn Mr. Quinn
Speaker.P: I am hesistant to make any commitment to a blank cheque which might be cashed some time in the future in circumstances that none of us can divine at this stage. I am, however, prepared to say that as Minister for Labour I am prepared to make sure that all the machinery for industrial relations, reconciliation and resolution available to me will be made fully available to both sides to find a satisfactory solution to this situation.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Would the Minister state whether the Labour Court will be at liberty to consider a well argued case for a continuation of the services on the Rosslare-Pembroke line with a larger ship, which has been proved to be satisfactory and, I submit, was possibly profitable.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Quinn Mr. Quinn
Speaker.P: The strike notice served by the FWUI was in respect of the proposed termination of the Rosslare-Pembroke service. Since talks have commenced this morning on the basis of that issue, I can only assume that that matter, among others, is being talked about. The concern of the Deputy would be the same as my own.

MainHeading.Title: Order of Business.

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: It is proposed to take Nos. 14, 25, 4 and 15. By agreement, the Dáil shall sit later than 9 p.m. today and not later than 11 p.m. and business shall be interrupted at 10.30 p.m.
